comments.text: It’s a very good spot! The ferry goes every 30 min and you can get on for free as a passenger. You can try ask cars before they go on the ferry, but it’s quite busy and people might not be in the headspace for it, since they are focused on following instructions to get on. Rather go on the ferry and ask people there or make a sign and stand there while people get on. I personally looked for german license plates first and asked them (my final goal was germany), but when they didn’t take me in, I

Ferry free for pedestrians and runs back and forth all the time. Easy to ask drivers while waiting.
Sunday 10am - Caught ride to Herceg Novi
Great place in both directions.
It's a great spot but if you have time, don't miss the bay area.

this is a marker for a ferry between Lepetane and Kamenari. The ferry charges cars but it\\'s free for passengers. You can load on the ferry while it\\'s waiting for the cars to load (usually 15minutes). Ferry ride is very short, few minutes. Ferry works both ways between this places. It is extremely easy once you are on the ferry, to ask any driver who\\'s in a car to give you a ride either towards the border with Croatia or backwards to Kotor/Budva. Recently, a new road up to Zabljak/Durmitor
Spot is great, plenty of space but not a lot of traffic goes there in the winter (also we are a mixed couple and that might explain why we waited).

Great spot if you want to head up to the mountain / mausoleum. Walked to the spot from Kotor in an hour. The ride up is super beautiful and getting a quick ride down wasn't an issue. 100% worth if you're staying in Kotor.
Priest took us to herzog novi

Very good spot with the cars and trucks coming from the ferry. You can go to the ferry from Kotor for only 1,50€ and then it's free for pedestrians. 
Got a ride in less than 2 minutes in a truck who dropped me before the border, picked me up just after to go to the croatian border and again picked me up back after the border to go directly to Dubrovnik. 
You can cross the border by walking (more than 1 km in a hill) or by hitchhiking.
Very easy spot to get to Budva. We held our sign up and the 4th car stopped and took us straight to the old town of Budva.
Two ladies bring us (and suggested) to swim in Jaz beach! They brought straight here but it is not usual destination.
The guy bring us straight in Budva centre. Nice catch!

Good place for hitchiking to Kotor, but me and my friends walked along the main road long time than we find this spot and it was not comofortable. We walked around 1 hour from Budva. I recomned to find some spot in the end of Budva.
Pretty nice spot. Can be chaotic because a lot of people stop there to buy stuff. We were standing at the bus stop with sign and thumb. We got a direct ride to budva after less than 10 miniutes.
Good spot, a lot of locals tring to hitchhike as well. The only minus is standing in the sun
we asked around a couple cars on the serb side of the border, if they could pick us up after they cross, and they did
Waited only for 10 minutes, but there were a lot of cars and because of the high speed they couldn't stop, but two men picked us up
perfect for long distance, good spot at the end of the town, cars are not going that fast and lots of room to stop
There is place to stop and a lot of people drive there to avoid the tunnel road. We got a ride very quickly
Good spot to ferry. There is room for cars to stop and little shade.
Extremely easy to get somewhere with the tourists
low traffic but a couple from belgium stopped and i had a nice drive to foca
Much more better to stop here than go to Sveti Stefan in case you go Budva or further, much more place to stop here.
Got quickly ride to berane even in 4 people
Pretty quick ride to plav
Got dropped here, nice group of girls took us after one minute, big space for cars to stop
We got a ride to Virpazar, but then just took a train to Bar. We didn't have any cash unfortunately, but the ticket inspector just let us stay on the train :)
Waited 2 mins here and 20 down the road close to the shop, got a ride with Albanians, ok traffic
There was mediocre traffic towards the border. Usually we (couple) were getting rides by foreigners and tourists, not locals and Balkans.
Sign Ulcijn, lots of traffic crossing the coast, easy drive to the big beach

I don’t know if we got lucky or this spot is perfect. EVERY car that passes here goes to Albania and not even 3 minutes passed until we got a ride. Originally we wanted to go to Shköder but an Ukrainian guy was on his way to Tiranë so he took us with him. We were 2 guys, not even a sign in our hands. (No shadows tho)
We crossed the border and immediately starter hitchhiking. The workers from the restaurant gave us a ride to Plužine.
There was a lot of trafic so we thought we could got a ride to leave the city, and actually got a ride straight to Podgorica.
Hitching with 3 people, busy spot with lots of cars, slightly chaotic but it was possible for cars to stop for us. Got a ride from two friendly guys on their way to a party in Herceg Novi.

We had to wait 5 minutes, great local lady took us! 
we had nice shadow for hitchhiking.
A nice guy picked up from previous spot in Tivat and brought us here.
this way towards budva seems better, if you went with the ferry it might be better to ask around there as there is no traffic besides the one from ot

Got randomly dropped here by my previous ride. One car every few minutes because of the border station earlier. Got a ride after a while with some Albanian locals that took me into Pejë. Really nice view though.
Good spot to go into Kosovo. Decent traffic and a good view. Got taken quickly but then the driver had to drop me between the Montenegro and Kosovo border stations for some reason.

Didn't have to wait too long until someone that already passed me turned around and picked me up. Was a very nice local with his wife. They took me for something to eat and drink in Rožaje and then made sure I was in a good spot to go into Kosovo.
Good spot, although cars go rather fast. I got dropped here and didn't have to wait long until a very nice guy took me. He showed me around his hometown, which was great.

We (2ppl) first waited on this road closer to the center. There was a lot more traffic, but no one stopped. At this spot there is less traffic but someone stopped soon. There is a pull in for busses here.
Not so many cars here, but we (2ppl) got a ride by the first car by a guy that worked at the hotel there. Amazing view.
Not many cars going here. We (2ppl) stayed in the lovely guest house here and got a ride to a bit further by two Dutch tourists. Very nice place.
Not many cars in the morning. But a incredibly nice place to wait. After over an hour the first car with a Russian tourist took us (2ppl) into the next city.
Not many cars, mainly tourists. We (2ppl) got a ride only up to the lookout and spent the night nearby.
Good place to get towards Virpazar. We (2ppl) got a ride with a somewhat confusing local. He might have been a taxi driver, but he took us for free and was very nice.
great ride, got to practice my serbian, and no one even checked our passports at the albanian border, they just waved us through! (even though the car had montenegrin plates)
Easy to get people to pull over going to kotor and further. Slower traffic too.

We walked from the bus stop in the center all the way to this spot as the road didn't have many good places to stand beforehand! Good spot, a lady stopped and took us to the Croatian border after about 20 minutes! There's a nice pull in area for cars and a long straight road for people to see you and contemplate picking you up! Good spot overall

Direction: Montenegro coast.
A little parking with market. Waiting only about 6mins to Ulcinj at around 8am
The first car stopped and took us to Rožaje! Great spot!
Good spot. Easy to park, people are slow. Got a ride tonKotor.
Good spot. A nice lady took us to Podgorica (with a sign « PG »)
Got picked up quickly by mother with son, who took me all the way to slovenia:D
nice busy spot. easy to get to the borders.

Got a ride to here from niksic, waited for 15 minutes if not less and catched a car to Zabljak. 
I'd say that it's better to go a bit up the road because cars go pretty fast around and don't have time to stop after they see you.
Just want to make a Break an a car stopt 1 min After i arived
Somoked one and got a Ride to Nikšić

As of March 8 2023, the main road from Albania to Podgorica is closed because of construction for about 20 meters in Tuzi, I was walking around it and got offered a ride before even putting my hand up. He asked for money but then let me ride for free all the way to Bajzë
Waited by the bus stop. No lay-by but a car stopped within 5 minutes who was going to Mostar
To South, Podgorica
parking, people park their cars for hiking, you can easily find a car back to Zabljak

We crossed the border on foot and than started to hitchhike immediatly behind the borders. Even the guards were helping us to got a ride. After than minutes they founds us a ride to Nikšić. However the car broke down and had to go back to Foča so we had to hitchhike again
Got a ride with two French women to Bar in 15 mins
Serbian Bosnian truck driver took us all the way to Trebinje
A bus stop. We were 2 people and got a ride in 4 minutes to Bar!
Just right after a border control. First stopped a bus and asked 8 euros, after refusal albanian with Italy plates stopped and took us to Podgorica. But I asked to drop me near waterfall.
Some traffic, guards didnt care about us, good spot to get to Podgorica

A truly unique place to hitch from. We hh ed right at the Albanian customs booth. Officers couldn't care less about us asking cars even before they went through customs. Excessively hot in summer, but awesome atmosphere.
Hitchhiking to Shkodra (male and female). An ethnic serb from Vraka (Shkoder Albania) who lived in Podgoirica took us in Shkoder with his Mercedez. :)))
After talking to some people we got a ride to Bosnia.
The first guy the I asked was going to Pogorice and took us to Jasenovo Polje (going to Žabljak)
Second guy we asked gave us a ride to Nikšiç
First car I asked with BiH plates took me to Foca. He even spoke a bit of English :)
Easy spot, fastest I got a ride in the trip
Nice spot to go to Bar

Waited for around 30 minutes at midnight after this some guy came and said that I'll never get a ride here at this time. Ten minutes after it a truck stops, i miss it but the truck that was immediately after the 1st one signaled that 1st stoped for me. In the end got a nice hike with decent talks, got dropped out in 5 minutes from my house. And considering that was at 12 and hitchhiking was my only option to get home for 5 more hours, that one hell of a lucky one.
Alternatively you can take a train. Train station is not so far from this place and trains in Montenegro are cheap (1,40€ to Virpazar; 2,00€ to Sutomore; 2,40€ to Bar; student discount 30%).

I was hitchhiking from this place to the seaside.
03.03.12 Sutomore with one guy, 5min
13.03.12 Bar with one guy, we gave up after 1,5h of waiting, everyone who stopped was only going to airport
18.03.12 Ulcinj with one guy, 15 min, we got ride to Bar from there to Ulcinj
got picked up quickly, went to Niksic
We got a ride to Nikšić pretty quickly from a guy going to work. Good place with space to pull up
Get a Ride from Lokals good Spot for them to hold
Good spot for going to the mountains - Sedlo for example
Decent area, enough traffic and didn't wait long. Was heading south but a good spot opposite if you wanted to go north.
Great spot, great people
Stood at the road and found someone going all the way to sarajevo pretty quickly
Lots of traffic, mostly Montenegrin plates. I ended up taken a ride to tuzi and I will try again from there
Perfect pull off area, tons of traffic headed towards Albania, but my first driver took me to Tuzi
Mid Spot but Good traffic
Great spot. Lot of cars passing by. After few minutes we got ride to Kotor
Got a ride to Tuzi without even hitchhiking. Nice guy saw me with my huge backpack and stopped to give me a ride to Tuzi! Plenty of space and traffic is relatively slow :)
Great spot for car to stop. We got ride quickly to Shkoder in Albania

Very good Spot to go to Albania. Went the from Bar Train Station 20 minutes walk. Stood the with a sign to Ulcinj and after 15-20 two guys from Albania, were taking us directly to Durres, so we were really glad 10/10 would recommend!
When we arrived point, one car stopped. It was good spot. We did December,  in rainy day
2 people, we got a ride to Ulcinj pretty quickly
A bus stop. We were 2 people and got a short distance ride in 14 minutes.
Many Albanians would offer you a ride to Ulcinj for like 5 EUR (varied from 10 EUR to 2 EUR after a small bargain), but we ended up getting a free ride from a Montenegrin.
Lots of traffic had a sign saying “PG” got picked up quick. Great bus stop for people to stop at
Really great spot, there is a bus stop, where cars can stop
First car took me to Podgorica
Stayed here with sign Cetinje, but our driver was going to Podgorica, so we going to there too.
I was trying to go to Podgorica, waited here for no more then like 3 min before a guy offerd me a ride to Cetinje which I toke.
Easy for Gusinje
Good spot towards Gusinje. A lot of traffic Plav-Gusinje.
We got a ride from the first car to Žabljak
We got ride to Žabljak very quickly
Decent
Got a ride to Ivanova Korita
There is a bus stop where people can stop. We got a ride to Podgorica very quickly
This spot is great in general. We wanted to go to Albania but nobody stopped. The moment we wrote down Ulcinj we got a ride. So maybe go to Ulcinj first if you want to go to Albania.
Lot of traffic and space to stop.
Pretty good spot, lots of traffic to Albania
Picked up by German tourists, taken all the way to Dubrovnik. Crossed two borders, had dinner, overall lovely experience. Waiting time may vary for those less fortunate
Got near the borders with Bosnia. Cars can easily stop on this place. Big chance you can cuddle with local dogs
Nice spot for heading to Bosnia. Even spotted a local using it.
Really the BEST spot to HH to Budva. Didn’t even wait 5 minutes until we got picked up by a Serbian guy. He took us to the roundabout, which leads to Budva.
Guy was driving dangerously, had to get off the car after 50 min of a stressful ride. The spot is great, seemed easy to get a ride in this area but be careful with the drivers.

Worked well. It was right after a traffic lights which meant people were sometimes to concentrate on the road to notice and stop also it was a bit difficult for them to stop because of the other cars close behind them after the traffic lights. But within 15 I had a good ride to Budva.
Very quick ride to Budva, plenty of space for cars to stop
Nice spot. Get a ride 3 times here. 2 times for budva and one to the next roundabout.
We were super lucky, took us one minute (probably bc. of the rain)
A good place on high speed road with lots of place to pull up. Some cars my going to fast though
Shady area, speeding drivers. If you're heading to Podgorica better take the train. It's less than 2 euros, and the views are incredible.
After road junction. Traffic goes to seashore (Kotor, Herceg-Novi) and Bosnia.

A lot of people just park on the road or the bus stop to go to the pekara, so it can be infuriating. Also some people want money, even as much as 10€ per person. Finally an Albanian man stopped for us. But he didn't give us any signal so we had to walk to ask him. Can't think of better spot to go to Shköder from Ulcinj though
2 Boys, we wanted to go to Albania and waited 20 minutes. We got a ride by a funny old guy to Krute Krythë.
good spot to go to albania
We just show the sign with Budva and the car in the moment stopped to us
good place, but hitchability at the end of the market area is also really good.
very good spot, easy to get a ride to Budva
Stay between the circle and the shops if heading to Budva.
Good spot towards

A guy was already using this spot when I arrived, so I moved up the road. After he got a ride (about 5 mins after I arrived), 2 cars parked in the bus stop! But a few minutes later, a taxi with one more free spot stopped for me...
10.03.12 - hitchhiking to Ostrog. After 1h of waiting we gave up and wanted to take a bus. But a truck, which was going in front of the bus we wanted to take, stopped.
From here you can get to Niksic or Ostrog.
even the natives are hitchhiking here
Got a ride in 15min to Kotor, around 3pm many cars passing by. A local woman picked me up and took to all the way to the old town
got a ride to the Kotor Bay ferry quite fast after the roundabout
we want to go to Kotor, but waited for half an hour and still not successful, there is another guy rushing for work in Kotor so we share a taxi (1.5 euro each x 3) to go to Kotor
Its okay spot to get to the sea, but be prepared that the way can take a lot of time during summer
A lot of traffic but, not many cars stop. We got a ride from other hitchhikers out of the city. We ran into them in Ulcinj the next day :)

Good spot to wait at the bus stop. Not many people will take you, but it just takes time. I first tried it down at the on road to the 'highway' but waited for one hour without any success, maybe because it was Easter saturday. Got picked up by a very friendly sailor from Montenegro that showed me his village and invited me for a drink.
Bus stop

I walked by foot through the tunnel and after that there is small place for drivers to stop. There was almost no traffic, in 10min only 2 cars, but actually the second one stopped - great guy living in the mountains, people are really helpful in this area.
This spot is bit tight, lot of locals hitch here as well, but we went without sign and had a ride to Budva kn 5 minutes.
I waited at the roundabout but than I figured I could also ask people at the gas station and it worked
Lots of cars that were going from Bar to Budva. There is some place to stop.
Good spot, since there's a place to pull down. A lot of sun tho
Not a lot of cars but eventually we got a ride to plav (2 males)

Had a sign with budva, an old lady took us but only in the direction 
(2 males)
Basically first car took us just there and told that it is better spot. We continued from here direction Budva

Somewhere there, there's a huge placeto stop with restoraunt in there.

Even though it's on the wrong side of the street(I was going Podgorica direction), i still managed to get a ride, as some cool lawyer guy turned his car around to pick me up and drive all way to Podgorice. He also suggested me a nice place where I could sit with my laptop, charge my devices and rest. It's called "Mtel Digitalna Fabrika" and people there are very nice! It's basically a cowork area, but they don't mind chill

After crossing border by feet at night, nobody was giving a ride, because at night all the truck drivers are just going to sleep right after crossing border and they go nowhere.

I slept here in hamak. But find more desolate place to sleep, because there are a lot of dogs around and two of them were barking at me non stop at night until I scared them with a flashlight.

In the morning it was easy, a little traffic from border, but I asked a car driver near Motel in here to give me a ride to
Ok spot. Enough of traffic in direction of Podgorica, but space to stop is only for cars, hitchhiking truck is nearly impossible
I was lucky and only had to wait for ten minutes for a local to take me to the next split in the road.
Not much traffic and not many stop. Got taken by two German women in a camper van. Nice place with shade and a bench.
Only a few cars passing by. We managed to find a car to Peć/Pejë in less than an hour. I’d recommend.
On the roundabout, next to the highway entrance. I found a car going to Niš, Serbia! I stopped in Berane. Good spot, some people may ask for money for the toll.
mostly tourists in cars = they dont stop, some nice lady took us to Pivsko jezero,she also bought something to drink. it is a good spot
Waited here from ~22-23:30 got picked up by a guy of Yemen origin that lives in bar, there was 2 more russian guys, a minute later we picked up two more guys from the same group.
Nice spot, I get a ride for Budva in 30min. There's a lot of car so better to make a sign
Quite a good spot for Kotor. After 20 minutes we got ride to Risan.
Good spot, we got lucky and after 20 minutes got ride to Nikšić. Even though it is the end of the season and not many cars passing by
Good spot but it was the end of the season so not many people going straight to Tara.
Got a ride to Budva in about 25 mins
To Petrovac
Many drove by, one finally stopped, first without sign, then swung 1/3 of the time a Budva sign. After 50 minutes somebody finnaly stopped, took us to Budva. We were 2 People, read as male.
There is a bus stop so plenty of space for the cars to stop. A guy took me to Podgorica
Took us to Kotor
We did not even have to ask people to stop. First car stopped only because he saw our bags.

It's a shortcut to off the main road, that goes to Albania. A good space to wait.
We were told that's the road people take. After 35 minutes we got a ride to Tirana, so it was a good decision to stand there!
We hitchiking when tunnel was closed and every car went the old way. In summer it could be good spot for route to Cetinje
Good spot from sutomore to Budva. Me and my friends stayed near the some restaurant, but there is possible to hitchike next to autoservis, where is a place to stop car too.

Maybe the road has been improved but cars going quite fast so didn't stop despite lots of space.
Albanians always asked for money, was so hot outside I eventually folded and took a lift to Schkoder for €5.
If you come from Podgorica, the spot by the roundabout there is maybe better as traffic is slower.
A good spot because cars have to slow down. At 5pm many workers go home to Albania (usually cars are full, but we got a ride after 20min to Shkoder).
An ethnic albanian took us after Vuksanlekici. Aftert that we walk until the border maybe 7 km or less.
Well, it's a spot. Cars stop, no problem, the road is too crappy to speed. Just remember "ska lek", and welcome to Albania.
Good spot but people didn't stop.
I got car directly for Ulcinj thanks to Russian family living in Montenegro ! 15 min waiting time MAXI
early august 2011 ; direction Ulcinj ; good spot, though some tried to ask money ; i refused

A very long wait on the way south out of bar. Traffic was very heavy was offered 3 separate rides to ulcinj for 5-10euros. 
Waited two hours until I got a ride. However locals were help in advising me.
In the opposite direction i got a ride from a trucker in 10minutes, who offered to take me to Bijelo Polje
Stood here for 80min until it started raining then took a bus :( (bus stop is a bit further after next roundabout leaving bar)
we (two guys) started on the 9.July (saturday), at 11 in the morning and Ive got a lift to Tivat. It took seconds by asking a couple of germans with a trailer.
Around 11am. Waited 70min then a car stopped which was going to bar. He wanted 10€
Slow cars coming out of Albania but if you were solo with less luggage I think it’ll be better. Got a hitch with a great dude all the way to bar!
got a ride to Shkodër
Got offered a ride to Ulcinj before finishing our sign, which said “Bar”, so we declined but later decided to go to Ulcinj and got a ride in 13 minutes.

Hitching with 3 people, the spot looked pretty good with quite some traffic and gas station but we still had to wait for some time. Eventually got picked up by a funny couple. When we had to wait in line at the border, the driver wanted to get as close as possible to the car in front of us. Then at one point he kept going and his girlfriend was like what are you doing?? And then he bumped into the car in front of us and that car bumped into the one in front of him. And we where shocked in the ba
Good spot In terms of space to pull over but not much traffic. Border would probably frighten people. Eventually got a ride just across it
Ask people waiting in line with you if they can take you to the next border post since you're on foot, maybe they will bring you further

May be an anomalously good experiance, but the first car stopped (they said they heard my accent and i was from their country as i was exiting passport control) and took me to the airport! beware that there is a singificant walk between the two border posts.
Cars Go fast from time to time but still a good spot to get out of Budva

Two boys, waited for 1h. A lot of local traffic but the best spot when you don’t wanna go to far out of the city to HH.
At the end we got 2 cars at the same time who could take us. We decided to go with a friendly Russian guy.
Boy and girl hitchhiking around 7pm, got a lift after 35 minutes to Bar. We used a sign saying “south”. Heads up, travelers. HH is not dead🤙

Almost immediately got a ride here from an old Albanian man. Although he wanted money, we could quickly haggle down to 5€ a person all the way to Shköder. It was no problem to us since it was the same price as the bus from Ulcinj to Shköder which we were planning to take.
He was nice and we also realize people don't have as much money in Albania as we do.
Gas station in the center of the city. The minus is that there is a lot of local traffic but it's still a good spot. Got a 40km ride in 40 minutes.

The road towards Pluzine is currently under repair (it should be until 2026). From crosroad go bit further and ofter couple minutes you will find okay spot with space for cars to stop. Be prepared that the traffic is very low.
Perhaps it was just an unlucky day but we had no luck. Hardly any traffic really. Eventually gave up and headed the opposite direction and got a ride in like 5 mins
Second car stopped. We wanted to go towards Durmitor. The lady went all the way to Zabljak
Good place to get to Bosnia direction. Here we get car straight to Sarajevo.Here is also beautiful place around - enjoy nature when you wait your car))
Sunday 8am, not much traffic. Stood here 70min then took the blue line bus (1,50€) to the ferry, where I approached the drivers.
Good spot, but are need to make you visible because of the trees. We started to hitchhike under the rain and in 10 minutes we got a ride up to Dubrovnik.
There is traffic light and right lane for driver to stop. After 15 minutes we got a hike all the way to Sarajevo. We are lucky.
There is a traffic light and an extra lane for those who are turning right. I waited there and got a ride almost to the border.
The spot in general is good with nice view, but the traffic is low, but after some time, you will get a ride. We got nice guys all the way to Sarajevo!
Good place, drivers can stop easily. Unfortunately not a lot of traffic. A Bosnian guy took me after 2 hours of waiting.
good spot, there is small space for cars to spot and the traffic is HUGE
Somewhere here you can find a shoulder, but not to big.
